required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TREXIMET (Formerly Known as TREXIMA) for the Acute Treatment of Probable Migraine (ICHD-II 1.6.1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of TREXIMA* (Sumatriptan Succinate/Naproxen Sodium) for a Single Moderate or Severe Headache in Adults Diagnosed With Probable Migraine Without Aura (ICHD-II 1.6.1) (*TREXIMET)

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed to determine the efficacy and tolerability of TREXIMET (formerly known as TREXIMA) compared to placebo for the acute treatment of probable migraine, a sub-type of migraine.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain-Free at 2 Hours Post-dose and Sustained Pain-Free From 2-24 Hours Post-dose.
primary_outcome.description: Pain-free was defined as a headache severity of no pain (grade 0) at 2 hours post-treatment in subjects who have not used rescue medication prior to or at the time of the assessment. Sustained pain-free response was defined as pain-free at 2 hours post-treatment through 24 hours post-treatment without rescue medicine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom From Headache Pain at 0.5, 1, and 4 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Pain-Free is defined as post-treatment headache pain severity of none in subjects who have not used rescue medication prior to or at the time of the assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained Headache Relief 2-24 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained pain relief was defined as having pain relief (mild or no pain) at 2 hours w/o any moderate or severe pain during 2-24 hour period post-treatment, without rescue medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Headache Relief at 4, 2, 1 and 0.5 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Pain relief was defined as reduction of headache pain from a baseline severity of moderate or severe to none or mild at the given time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects Who Used Rescue Medication From 0 - 24 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue medication defined as additional medication (i.e. sumatriptan/naproxen sodium as open-label rescue or other medication as permitted per protocol), taken by subject for the treatment of headache pain or other symptoms associated with the headache attack.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intermediate Sustained Pain Relief: Post-dose at Intervals of 2-4 Hours and 1-2 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Intermediate sustained pain relief was defined as achieving headache pain relief (from moderate or severe pain at baseline to mild or no pain) prior to the specified timepoint (1 or 2 hours) and maintaining it to the specified timepoint (2-4 hours). (Intermediate=Intermed.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Intermediate Sustained Pain-Free: Post-dose at Intervals of 2-4 Hours and 1-2 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Intermediate sustained pain free was defined as achieving headache pain-free (moderate or severe pain to no pain) prior to the specified timepoint (1 or 2 hours) and maintaining it to the specified timepoint (2-4 hours).(Intermediate=Intermed.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Headache Associated: Neck Pain, Sinus Pain, Photophobia, Phonophobia, Nausea at Time Intervals of 4 and 2 Hours After Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Neck pain, sinus pain, photophobia, phonophobia and nausea are considered headache-associated symptoms.(Headache-associated=Headache-Assoc.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Medication Satisfaction: Mean Patient Perception of Migraine (PPMQ-R) Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Perception of Migraine Questionnaire-Revised(PPMQ-R) evaluates subject satisfaction with treatment 24 hours post-dose using validated questions. Questions are analyzed on 4 subscale scores (efficacy, functionality, ease-of-use, and tolerability) and total score. Scores range from 0-100, with the higher scores indicating better satisfaction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least a 6 month history of probably migraine (6 migraine attacks per month)
- Males and women of childbearing potential on a adequate contraception.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physician diagnosis of migraine; history of triptan or ergot use; history of headache prophylaxis use
- Pregnant and/or nursing mother
- History of cardiovascular disease.
- Uncontrolled hypertension.
- Basilar or Hemiplegic migraine
- History of stroke or transient ischemic attacks (TIA).
- History of epilepsy or treated with anti-epileptics within the past 5 years.
- Impaired hepatic or renal function.
- History of gastrointestinal bleeding or ulceration.
- Allergy or hypersensitivity to Aspirin or any other NSAID.
- Allergy or hypersensitivity to triptans.
- Participated in an investigational drug trial in the previous 4 weeks.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

results_reference.citation: Silberstein S, Lipton RB, Goldstein J, Aurora SK, White J, Ochs-Ross R, Lener SE, McDonald SA. Evaluation of a New Fixed-dose Single Tablet of Sumatriptan Formulated with RT Technology and Naproxen Sodium (SumaRT/Nap) for the Acute Treatment of Probable Migraine without Aura. Headache 2008: presented at the American Headache Society Meeting, Boston, MA.

clinical_study.keyword: Probable migraine, a sub-type of Migraine

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

group.title: Sumatriptan/Naproxen
group.description: Sumatriptan 85 mg and Naproxen sodium 500mg = Treximet (formerly known as Trexima)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Baseline Characteristics used the Safety Population. Not the Randomised Population

group.title: Sumatriptan/Naproxen
group.description: Sumatriptan 85 mg and Naproxen sodium 500mg = Treximet. Baseline Characteristics used the Safety Population. Not the Randomised Population

class.title: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Pain-Free at 2 Hours Post-dose and Sustained Pain-Free From 2-24 Hours Post-dose.
outcome.description: Pain-free was defined as a headache severity of no pain (grade 0) at 2 hours post-treatment in subjects who have not used rescue medication prior to or at the time of the assessment. Sustained pain-free response was defined as pain-free at 2 hours post-treatment through 24 hours post-treatment without rescue medicine.
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat (ITT) Population was the primary analysis population for assessing efficacy and included subjects who treated at least 1 headache attack with randomized treatment and provided at least one post dose evaluation.

group.title: Sumatriptan/Naproxen
group.description: Sumatriptan 85 mg and Naproxen sodium 500mg = Treximet (formerly known as Trexima)

Sustained pain-free response was defined as pain-free at 2 hours post-treatment through 24 hours post-treatment without rescue medicine.

analysis.p_value_desc: Endpoints were co-primary and both needed to have p-value of <0.05 to be considered indicative of efficacy.
analysis.estimate_desc: Analysis for Migraine Pain-Free at 2 hours Post-Dose

outcome.population: ITT Population - Actual numbers of subjects who took questionnaire were Placebo 199 and Sumatriptan/Naproxen=188

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the Publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on Single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
